entry.title: Setting the hostname in Arch Linux
entry.content:
Set a hostname:

$ sudo hostnamectl set-hostname my-pretty-cow

Get the hostname (Linux standard):

$ hostname [-f]

See Network Configuration: Set the hostname

entry.title: Installing Dropbox in Arch Linux
entry.content:
Install

From AUR you can install with:

yaourt -S dropbox dropbox-cli

Configuration

This command will show you a GUI in XWindow to configure the account:

$ dropboxd &

It will ask you if you want to run it from an unsupported location. The unsupported location is AUR instead of the pacakges of Dropbox, so, say yes.

To start syncing files in the background, use:

$ dropbox start

Once there it will start fetching files. You can see the overall status with:

$ dropbox status

And the status for a given file:

$ dropbox filestatus <path>

You may be interested in enabling the autostart:

$ dropbox autostart y

and disable the syncronisation in the local network for security reasons:

$ dropbox lansync n

For more options, take a look:

$ dropbox --help

References

  • Dropbox – ArchLinux

entry.title: Octopress install on Arch Linux
entry.content:
Requisites

  • Git (I assume this is already installed)
  • Ruby 1.9.3
  • Rbenv
  • Ruby-build for Rbenv
  • Octopress
  • Octopress dependencies

Ruby

It is just:

$ sudo pacman -S ruby

It installed 1.9.3p327 for me. Revisions can be managed via rbenv.

rbenv and ruby-build

I installed this via GitHub, the idea was:

$ git clone git://github.com/sstephenson/rbenv.git ~/.rbenv

Ruby-build is a plugin for rbenv:

$ git clone git://github.com/sstephenson/ruby-build.git ~/.rbenv/plugins/ruby-build

It doesn’t need further installation, but rbenv needs some changes for the shell:

$ echo 'export PATH="$HOME/.rbenv/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.bash_profile
$ echo 'eval "$(rbenv init -)"' >> ~/.bash_profile

Those changes may give problems if you were using RVM.

RVM and rbenv are not compatible with each other and both activate wrappers for the shell from .bashrc, .bash_profile or .profile.

Once your shell config is right reload it to apply changes:

$ source .bash_profile

Then, you can install another version of Ruby, if you want/need to:

$ rbenv install 1.9.3-p194
$ rbenv rehash

Octopress and dependencies

Clone the project and install the ruby environment:

$ git clone git://github.com/imathis/octopress.git octopress
$ gem install bundler
$ rbenv rehash
$ bundle install

This last command should start installing all the dependencies for Octopress.

Just to start the configuration:

$ rake install

and eventually this to use GitHub Pages:

$ rake setup_github_pages

From now on, you may want to refer to Deploying to Github Pages

Also, could be interesting add this remote to ease the Octopress Updates:

$ git remote add octopress git@github.com:imathis/octopress.git

References

  • Octopress Setup
  • rbenv
  • ruby-build
  • archlinux – Ruby
  • Deploying to Github Pages
  • Octopress Updates
